content: FOUR! Edged away, and that will do nicely for England as they seal the T20I series 2-0 with a game in hand. Back of a length and in the channel around off, Brydon Carse throws his hands at it and gets a thick outside edge that flies wide of the keeper and rolls away into the fence. ENGLAND WIN BY 4 WICKETS!
A proper bumper now, over middle and coming in at a difficult height. Carse leaves it alone.
A slowish short ball from Holder, angled in towards the batter. Brydon Carse charges down the track and looks to pull it away but is well beaten.
On a hard length and outside off, Brydon Carse plays it late and cuts it down to deep third for one more.
Back of a length and well outside off, Banton wanders out of his crease and moves to the off side before just angling the ball down to deep third for a single.
FOUR! That is sublime timing from Tom Banton. Pitched up around middle, Banton just walks into the line of the ball and maneuvers the on drive wide of mid on and the ball races away to the fence.
Full and angled in towards the pads, Brydon Carse manages to nudge it down well behind square leg for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! A wicket out of nowhere for Alzarri Joseph but perhaps it is a bit too late. Joseph bowls it full and quick and pushes it wide enough of the off stump. Will Jacks has to reach for it and even though the ball pings off the bat, Jacks can't control it. The ball goes uppishly and wide of covers where Roston Chase puts in a dive to his right and snaffles a brilliant catch.
Will Jacks c R Chase b A Joseph 7 (7b 0x4 0x6)

Good work in the deep by Romario Shepherd! Pitched-up delivery, darting into the pads, Will Jacks picks it up and whips it down towards the square leg fence. Romario takes the catch just inside the ropes but manages to flick the ball in as there was a chance of him going over the ropes. The catch wouldn't have counted anyway, so he did well to save the six. Two taken!
Wide! Hits the deck hard but pushes the ball well wide outside the off stump. Left alone by Jacks and the Free Hit stays.

NO BALL! Four extra runs as well! Wayward from Alzarri Joseph and that last over seems to have rattled him. This is a high full toss that is darted well down leg and the ball races past the diving keeper and into the fine leg fence. Free Hit coming up...

FOUR! Oh, that's risky but highly skillful from Tom Banton. Full and straight, Jason Holder almost nails it in the blockhole but Banton nonchalantly reverses it in between short third and backward point for a boundary. That was picked right off the pads.
Takes some pace off this one and angles it into middle and leg, Will Jacks wrists the ball away to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Bowled very full and around the base of off stump, Jacks drives it along the tuf and straight to mid off.
On the fuller side and at the stumps, Jacks clips it away gently and into the big space in front of mid-wicket and comes back for the second run with ease.
Wide! An attempted bumper now, bowled around middle, Jacks looks to pull but pulls out of the shot as the ball sails over his head.
This one is floated up, full and outside off, Will Jacks leans across and strokes the ball away wide of deep covers and picks up a couple of easy runs.
Length ball on the pads, whipped across to deep mid-wicket for a single by Banton.

OUT! CAUGHT! No doubt about that one but Jacob Bethell will feel he has done his job here. Alzarri Joseph slips in a very full ball across the off stump. Bethell tries to be a bit cheeky and tries to reverse ramp it over short third but gets the timing all wrong. The ball gets lobbed straight to the fielder inside the ring and Roston Chase takes a simple catch. The umpire do concur with the third umpire and everything seems fine. Bethell departs after a cameo of 26 from just 10 balls.
Jacob Bethell c R Chase b A Joseph 26 (10b 1x4 3x6)

SIX! Jacob Bethell is ripping Alzarri Joseph apart here and England are gunning the runs down rather quickly now. This is bowled short and wide, Bethell gets up on his toes and smashes it flat and hard over cover-point for another biggie.
Good-length delivery, on the pads, Banton clips it away through square le and turns the strike over.
Back of a length and slanting across off, Bethell hangs back and punches it through covers for a single.

SIX! Oh, that's even better from the southpaw! Alzarri serves this one on a good length and tries to angle it across off. Jacob Bethell just holds his shape and gets under the ball before clobbering it over long off for a mammoth biggie.

SIX! That is out of here! Alzarri Joseph comes back into the attack and slides one full onto the pads to begin with. Jacob Bethell picks it up and swings it a long way behind deep square leg for a biggie.
SIX! Spoils the over completely for Motie, does Banton. Darted in full and into middle and leg, Tom Banton skips down the pitch and manages to power it wide of long on for a biggie. 14 off the over!
FOUR! Nicely done! Floated up, on a length and around off, Tom Banton brings out the reverse sweep and nails it through the vacant short third region for a boundary.
Tossed up around off, driven on the up and uppishly dow to long off for just one more by Bethell.
Banton is quick to come down the track and Motie just floats it on the pads. Banton flicks it away in front of square leg for one more.
This one is fired in full and across the left-hander, Jacob Bethell comes down the track and drills it to long off for another single.
Quick and flat on middle, Tom Banton quickly backs away and cuts it off the stumps through point for a single.

Short and quick arm ball on leg, Jacob Bethell looks to flick it and gets beaten as the ball hits his front pad. A loud appeal for LBW follows. But the umpire is unmoved. Perhaps it's going down leg. 15 off this over, and this could be mighty helpful for England to counterpunch.
Full toss on off, Tom Banton drives it to long on for a single.
Again short and wide outside off, Tom Banton again shoulders his arms to that one. Roston Chase is perhaps looking to keep it out of Tom Banton's reach there. Another wide.
A touch short and outside off, Tom Banton leaves it alone. Wide given.
SIX! Oh hello! Tom Banton doesn't need any sighters! Full and in the slot on middle, Tom Banton slog sweeps it over deep mid-wicket for a six to get off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT! Roston Chase has his man! He gets Harry Brook for the second time in the series, with a similar delivery! Full and well outside off, quicker through the air, Harry Brook goes for the inside out hit over covers, but ends up hitting it off the toe end, as the ball goes to the left of long off, where Rovman Powell runs to his left and completes another fine catch. And now, from the comforts of 112/2, England has slipped down to 126/4, with both well-settled Brook and Buttler departing in a quick span of deliveries. West Indies back in the game holding an upperhand here.
Harry Brook (c) c R Powell b R Chase 34 (20b 2x4 2x6)
Short, quick and outside off, Harry Brook looks to cut it but gets beaten on the outside edge.
SIX! Harry Brook welcomes Roston Chase into the attack with a six! Full, fired on off, Harry Brook was ready for it, hits it fiercely over long off for six. That went a long way.
FOUR! Jacob Bethell on the charge! Tossed up on middle, Jacob Bethell skips down the track and hits a one bounce four over the bowler's head.
Full on leg, Harry Brook flicks it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.

Full on middle leg, Harry Brook gently pushes it into the leg side to the left of deep mid-wicket and calls for two. The fielder was quick to run across the turf and fire in a throw at the striker's end. The wicket keeper collects the throw and whips off the bails. Is Harry Brook short? The decision is referred to the third umpire. Oh, the slow motion video clearly shows that Harry Brook has comfortably made it back to the crease. NOT OUT!
Short and outside off, Jacob Bethell cuts it off the back foot to deep extra cover for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Johnson Charles can breathe a sigh of relief! Full and outside leg, Jos Buttler lines for the reverse sweep and gets it off the bottom of the bat to the left of deep point, where Johnson Charles takes the catch. Akeal Hosein has his first and England have lost their third wicket - 112/3. Jos Buttler departs for a well-made 47 (36).
Jos Buttler (wk) c J Charles b A Hosein 47 (36b 4x4 2x6)
Short length delivery, outside off, Buttler pushes it to short cover off the back foot. Dot ball.

FOUR! Lucky for Harry Brook, but that was a poor delivery from Romario Shepherd! Low full toss outside off, Harry Brook looks to steer it as he gets an outside edge that flies to the right of the wicket-keeper and goes for four at the deep third fence.
Full and well outside off, Harry Brook walks across in an attempt to play the scoop, but then seeing the line of the ball, he plays the clip to the right of deep mid-wicket and takes two runs.
WIDE! Goes for the wide yorker, does Shepherd, beyond the tramline on the off side. Harry leaves it alone. Wide called.

FOUR! Slammed away! A slower delivery, back of a length and outside off, Harry Brook waits for the ball to arrive, pounces on the width offered, and slashes it over the cover region for a cracking boundary.
SIX! Lovely timing! Full toss on middle, Brook makes some room and carves it over backward point for a six. What a shot, that!
Short pace off delivery on middle, Jos Buttler pulls it on the bounce to deep mid-wicket for a singlle.
Slower length delivery, on off. Harry Brook punches it off the back foot to deep extra cover for a single.
Full length slower delivery wide outside off, That one slipped out of Romario Shepherd's hand. Harry Brook leaves it alone. Wide given.

Drifted into the pads, on a length, Harry Brook nudges it along the turf for a single at deep square leg. An excellent over from Motie. 5 off this over, and just 9 from the last two for England. West Indies were 92/2 at the same stage, just one run ahead of the hosts.
Good length and fired into the pads, Buttler tucks it to mid-wicket for a run.
full on off, Buttler drives it to short extra cover. Dot ball.
Short and outside leg stump, quicker delivery, Harry Brook pulls it to the right of deep mid-wicket for a single.
Short on middle, Jos Buttler makes some room and looks to heave it over extra cover, but the ball hits the inner half of his bat and goes back past the bowler to long on for a single.
Short and outside off, Harry Brook cuts it to the left of deep point and takes a single.

Length ball on leg, Alzarri Joseph this times follows Harry Brook as he angles this one into the right hander, Harry Brook looks to play the pull but doesn't get any bat on it, as the ball hits him near the ribcage area and drops into the ground. Batters sneak in a leg bye. At the halfway stage in the chase, England are 87/2, needing another 110 runs off the last 10 overs.

Full and outside off, Harry Brook moves away, and seeing that, Alzarri Joseph fires this one well outside off, Harry Brook looks to reach out for it as he looks to steer it towards the third man region, but doesn't get any bat on it.

DROPPED! Evin Lewis shells a crucial catch and that should have been taken! Short ball on middle, Jos Buttler makes some room and goes for the pull, he doesn't middle it whatsoever, as he ends up skying it to deep mid-wicket. The ball swirls up in the sky, traveling towards deep mid-wicket. Johnson Charles there, does settle under it, but doesn't hang onto it as he fails to judge the ball's trajectory. Hence, the ball pops out of his palms and lands just beside him. A costly drop that. Batters take a single.
Jos Buttler looks to play the scoop, spotting it early, Alzarri Joseph fires in a full ball, fairly wide of off. Jos Buttler still goes for the scoop, but doesn't get any bat on it.
Length ball on leg, Harry Brook moves away to create room and plays the cut, but he gets an inside edge that goes behind the wicket to the left of the wicket-keeper. Single taken.
Full on middle, angled into the right hander, Jos Buttler flicks it along the ground to deep mid-wicket. Single taken.
Short and flat on off, Jos Buttler punches it off the back foot to long on for a single.
FOUR! Jos Buttler again with his reverse sweep! Darted fuller and on leg, Jos Buttler is quick enough to turn and reverse sweep this one over the backward point fielder for four.
Fuller on off, Buttler drives it to short extra cover. Dot ball.
Quicker and flatter on middle leg, Harry Brook rocks on the back foot and punches it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Again a short and flat arm-ball, on middle, Jos Buttler pushes it into the leg side. Akeal Hosein, the bowler, runs to his right and cuts it off. Single taken.
Short length arm ball on middle, Harry Brook works it off the back foot to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Pace on, length ball on middle, Harry Brook plays the push off the back foot, to the left of deep mid-wicket for a single to keep the strike.
Pace off, length ball on middle, Jos Buttler gently pushes it into the leg side towards deep mid-wicket for a single.
Length ball on middle, Harry Brook flicks it to deep mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! CAUGHT! Romario Shepherd has his first break! Rovman Powell has taken a stunner! Back of a length delivery on middle, Ben Duckett goes for the pull, but does not find the timing right on the shot. The connection is nowhere near the middle of the bat, and the ball goes flat in the air, and well to the left of long on. However, Rovman Powell stationed at long on covers a lot of ground running to his left and takes a tumbling catch in the end. A crucial breakthrough for West Indies as the dangerous-looking Ben Duckett departs for 30 (18) and England are 72/2.
Ben Duckett c R Powell b R Shepherd 30 (18b 4x4 1x6)
Full on middle, Ben Duckett clips it in the gap between deep mid-wicket and long on for two runs.
Attempted bouncer aimed at the body, that goes well over the bowler's head, who doesn't offer any shot to the ball. Wide given.
Slower full length ball on middle, Jos Buttler flicks it along the ground to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Full and wide outside off, Jos Buttler leaves it alone. Wide given.
Short on middle leg, Jos Buttler works it off the back foot to deep mid-wicket for a single.
A touch short and slower through the air, on middle, Jos Buttler defends it off the back foot.
Overpitched on off, Ben Duckett drives it off the front foot to long on. Single taken.
Full and on leg, Jos Buttler drives it down to long on for a single.
SIX! Jos Buttler with a reverse sweep six! Short and outside off, poor delivery. Jos Buttler has all the time to play the reverse as he lifts it over short third for a six.
A touch short on middle, Jos Buttler stays back and blocks it off the back foot to short cover.
Fired full in length, at the leg stump line. Jos Buttler clips this to deep mid-wicket for a single. England end their Powerplay at 58/1 on the board.

IN THE AIR...Lands safe! Buttler gets away with it! Alzarri Joseph rolls his fingers off the rock, and lands this full and outside off. Jos Buttler is a bit early to play the lofted cover drive and ends up slicing it over the point region. However, luckily for him, the ball lands in the vacant region and is picked up by Evin Lewis who sprints from the inner ring to chase it. A couple of runs taken.

FOUR! What a lovely shot this! Stand and deliver! Not too full, not too short, on off, Jos Buttler stands tall and hits it through the line. He just lofts it over the bowler for a cracking boundary down the ground. The stand between these two moves to 46 runs now.
Nagging length, over the top of middle, Jos Buttler charges down the track to pull it across the line, but misses to connect as the ball passes over his angled bat.

A well-directed sharp bumper. Following the batter who moves to the leg side, angling on the bodyline with a zip off the deck as well, Jos Buttler attempts to pull it away, but misses and the ball passes around his shoulder height.
FOUR! The 50 is up for England! Alzarri Joseph is greeted with a boundary on his introduction! Length-delivery, angled on the pads, Jos Buttler whips it over mid-wicket comfortably for a boundary.

SIX! Innovative and mighty effective! Just a yard behind the fuller length, aimed at the stumps. Ben Duckett shuffles across the line and executes the scoop shot to perfection. Gets it over the keeper and has enough wood on it to clear the ropes behind for half a dozen. Highly skillful batting this!
Bowls into the bodyline of the batter, on a length, Ben Duckett charges a bit ahead and just adjusts to tuck it to the mid-wicket region.
FOUR! THRASHED AWAY! Back of a length, angled across off, Ben Duckett gets right on top of teh bounce and slaps this between cover and point for a boundary.

A mild appeal for LBW, but it is pitching outside leg, on a length. Ben Duckett looks to steer it into the leg side but misses. The ball rolls off the front pad to the backward point region. Duckett looks to sneak a leg bye but is sent back. The throw is flat and towards the batting end, but since the fielder misses to strike the direct hit, Duckett gets home by dragging the bat with a dive.
Fuller and outside off, Jos Buttler lofts it over the cover region, but off the toe end of the bat. The ball trickles to the fence but is mopped by the fielder in the deep. Three taken.
Starts off by firing it in fuller and on the leg stump, Ben Duckett flicks this along the turf for a single at deep backward square leg.
Short of a good length, on middle and leg, Ben Duckett pulls this strongly to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Speared it full, and wide of off, Ben Duckett looks to carve it out to the off side, but misses to lay any bat on it.
Length-delivery, on the stumps, Jos Buttler nudges it to the mid-wicket region for a single.

FOUR! Not at all where he intended to hit, but he will take it! Speared it full and on off, Jos Buttler shuffles across to lap it over short fine leg, but gets a thick outside edge and the ball goes past the short third region for a boundary.
SIX! SHOT! Serves it full and on the stumps, Jos Buttler clears the front leg and smashes it over long on for a cracking six.
Nagging length, on off, Buttler taps it off the back foot to the point region.

FOUR! Oh, that burst through Lewis' hands. To be fair to him, it was struck at a rate of knots! Fuller and on the stumps, Ben Duckett switches his stance and takes it on the full, reverse sweeping it over the leaping Evin Lewis at cover. He gets his fingertips on the ball, but it bursts through and races away for a boundary.
Short and outside off, punched to the left of diving point fielder for a single.
Length ball, drifting into middle and leg. Jos Buttler hangs back and taps it back to the bowler.
Full around off, placed to the point region by Buttler.
Full and around middle, Ben Duckett flicks this to deep square leg for one.
FOUR! Nicely executed! A yard behind fuller length, on off, Ben Duckett reverse sweeps this past backward point for a boundary. Good placement from the southpaw there.
Back of a length and outside off, seaming away with some extra bounce. Buttler takes a step ahead and across to the off side before shouldering arms at it.

Bump-ball! For a second, it felt like Rovman Powell dropped a sharp chance there. Jason Holder floats a full and wide one outside off, enticing the batter. Ben Duckett backs away and laces the cover drive but he jams the ball into the ground and towards cover where Powell fumbles on the stop and allows a single.
On the fuller side and at the stumps, Ben Duckett blocks it off.
A stifled appeal for LBW from the bowler but turned down. Good-length ball at the pads, angling in, Jos Buttler misses the flick and the ball goes off the pads to square leg for a leg bye.

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! England lose their first wicket way too early! Lands it full, does Holder, around the off stump line. Jamie Smith again attempts to sail it over long off, but does not get the timing correct again. Ends up slicing it aerially, off the toe-end of the bat and the ball sails over mid off. Gudakesh Motie runs towards the left, almost slips it out of his hands, but manages to cling on it with both hands.
Jamie Smith c G Motie b J Holder 4 (5b 0x4 0x6)

IN THE AIR... But safe! Holder starts off from over the stumps, bowls it full and just outside off at a gentle pace. Jamie Smith is quite early into his shot and goes through it. Slices it up and over mid off. But luckily for him, the ball lands in the safe zone and is chased by Gudakesh Motie from the inner ring. Two taken.

FOUR! Through the gap! Overpitched delivery, drifting on middle and leg, Ben Duckett sweeps it behind square and gets a boundary at deep backward square leg. A decent first over for the hosts. 7 off it.
Full again, around middle, worked to long on for a single.
Pitched around off, flat and full, Ben Duckett switches his stance to play the reverse, but toe-ends it wide of mid off for a single.
Nice and full, tossed on middle and leg, clipped to mid-wicket.
Shortish, on off, Jamie Smith rocks back and punches it to the widish cover region for a quick single.
Around the stumps, outside off on a length, Smith punches off the back foot to the cover region where the fielder dives to his left and parries the ball to the point fielder.

SIX! Roston Chase has provided the perfect ending to the West Indies innings! Full and angled across a touch, outside off, but the length is too full. Roston Chase, who is standing deep in his crease, clears his front leg and lofts it over the bowler's head for six.

OUT! RUN OUT! Quick work from Jos Buttler! Slower length-delivery, outside off, and angling across. Jason Holder looks to play the pull as he gets an inside edge that goes on the bounce to the wicket-keeper. Romario Shepherd, the non-striker, calls for one, and Jos Buttler is quick enough to fire a direct hit underarm throw at the striker's end as Romario Shepherd is well short of his crease.
Romario Shepherd run out (Jos Buttler) 19 (11b 0x4 2x6)

FOUR! Full and wide outside off, Jason Holder premeditates the line and walks across as he throws his bat at that wide delivery. The ball takes the outside half off the bat and flies over short third for four.

Back of the hand pace off delivery, wide outside off, fuller in length, Romario Shepherd looks to loft it over long off, but he is deceived by the change of pace, as he hits it off the bottom of the bat. The ball goes on the bounce to long off. Single taken.
Full and wide outside off, Jason Holder again clears his front leg and looks to loft it downtown, but this time he gets an inside edge that goes into the leg side. Single taken.
FOUR! West Indies are getting just the finish they were looking for! Full and just outside off, Jason Holder goes deep clears his front leg and smashes it wide of the diving mid off for four.

SIX! Five sixes in the over! 31 runs off the over!  Another overpitched delivery, this time outside off, Romario Shepherd has no problems, as he uses his long levers to good effect and lofts it over long off for the biggest six of the lot.

SIX! Now it's Romario Shepherd's turn! Six number four of the over! Full and in the slot, Romario Shepherd goes downtown as he hits it over the bowler's head. The ball lands straight into the sight screen.
Quick leg break, fuller, on off, Jason Holder walks across to cover the line, and goes for the slog hit, but gets an inside edge, that goes to short fine leg. Single taken.
SIX! Six number three for Jason Holder! Short and on middle leg, Jason Holder goes for the pull and manages to get it over long on for the third six of the over.
SIX! Back-to-back sixes! This is a leg break, bowled a touch fuller, on middle, Jason Holder clears the front foot, and lofts it over long on, for another six.
SIX! Short and pulled! Flipper, which lands short on middle, Jason Holder has easy pickings as he pulls it well over deep mid-wicket fence for a big six. This brings up 150 for West Indies!
Pace-off delivery, a touch fuller in length, outside off, Romario Shepherd looks to go aerial as he goes for a wild slog, but the bat manages to connect with thin air, as he gets beaten on the shot.

Back of a length, well outside off, Romario Shepherd goes for the pull and gets beaten on the outside edge, as the ball zips through the surface and bounces over his angled bat. That was quick from Brydon Carse!
Length ball, on middle, Jason Holder defends it off the back foot, towards long on for a single to get off the mark.

OUT! CAUGHT! Rovman Powell has to go! Brydon Carse has got the big wicket! Full and wide outside off, Rovman Powell looks to loft this one over the deep extra cover region, but doesn't get it off the middle of the bat as he hits it to the left of Luke Wood, who takes a good sliding catch to his left. A superb catch from Wood to dismiss the dangerous-looking Powell, who departs on a quickfire 34 (15). West Indies are 148/5 down now.
Rovman Powell c L Wood b B Carse 34 (15b 3x4 2x6)

SIX! Rovman Powell is playing a serious cameo here! He has raced away to 34 off 14 balls! This is a length ball on off, Rovman Powell pulls it over the long on fence for a six. That sounded so good off the bat and it was a six the moment he hit it.
Full on middle, Romario Shepherd swings through the line, as the ball goes along the ground to the right of long on. Single taken.

FOUR! Poor from Liam Dawson and gets the treatment! 20 runs off the over. Short and width on offer, Rovman Powell cuts it fiercely in front of square, as the ball goes racing away to the fence like a tracer bullet. Liam Dawson ends his spell going wicketless, concedes 43 off his four overs.
Short on off, Romario Shepherd cuts it past the diving backward point fielder, who puts in a dive and gets a hand to it, which helps in slowing down the pace of the ball. Single taken.
Rovman Powell again looks to come down the track, seeing it, Liam Dawson fires in a yorker on middle, Rovman Powell digs it out as he drives it to long on for a single.

FOUR! Now Rovman Powell gets a touch lucky! Slightly fuller, orthodox delivery, turning away around off, Rovman Powell goes for the front foot defense as he gets a thick outside edge that runs away fine of the short third man fielder for four.
SIX! Rovman Powell on the charge! Liam Dawson tosses this one up, on off, Rovman Powell accepts the invitation as he skips down the track and lofts it over the bowler's head for a maximum.
FOUR! Smashed away! Short on middle, Rovman Powell rocks on the back foot and pulls it along the ground in the gap between deep square leg and deep mid-wicket for four.

Length ball angled across, outside off, Romario Shepherd looks to cut it, but doesn't quite middle it as he hits along the ground and behind point. The batters do well to race back for the second run.
A back-of-the-hand pace-off delivery, fuller in length, on off, Romario Shepherd drills the drive straight to mid off.

Back of a length, just outside off, Romario Shepherd guides this one past the short third man fielder. The fielder from deep backward point runs to his left and cuts it off near the boundary. Batters complete two runs.
Full on middle, Romario Shepherd defends it back to the bowler.

OUT! BOWLED! Johnson Charles's scratchy knock comes to an end! Luke Wood fires this one full and wide outside off, Johnson Charles moves across the stumps, and looks to scoop it over fine leg. But only gets an inside edge that crashes back into the sticks. Charles walks back to the dugout after scoring 47 (39), and from 90/1, West Indies have slipped down to 117/4.
Johnson Charles b L Wood 47 (39b 3x4 3x6)
Length ball on leg, Rovman Powell flicks it to short fine leg for a single.

Pace-off delivery, on a length, on middle, Rovman Powell looks to have a piece of it as he goes for the pull. The ball hits the upper part of his bat and falls just short of deep backward square leg. Single taken.
Good length ball sliding down leg, Rovman Powell looks to help it on its way, but doesn't get any bat on it. Wide given.
Length ball on off, Rovman Powell blocks it right under his eyes.
Pace off, Length ball on middle, Johnson Charles goes for the slog shot and hits it on two bounces to the left of deep mid-wicket for a single.
Back of a length, aimed at the body, Johnson Charles looks to pull it as the ball hits his gloves and lobs up in the air and falls in front of the wicket-keeper.
Length ball, on middle, Johnson Charles moves away a touch to make some room and plays the steer to short third. Dot ball.
Length ball on off, Rovman Powell steers it to the right of short third for a single.

Slower through the air, landing outside leg, full in length. Rovman Powell leans on the ball with a huge stride and clips it to deep square leg for a single. 12 off this over, 19 from the last two for the Windies. Adil Rashid's figures so far read 3-0-28-1.
Short again, over the top of middle, Rovman Powell hangs back and pulls it wide of deep mid-wicket for a couple of more runs.
A googly, spinnng back on the pads, Johnson Charles pulls this length ball to deep square leg for one.
SIX! Into the wheelhouse and Adil pays the penalty! A juicy half volley on off, Johnson Charles just hoists it over long on for a powerful six.
Slows it up, but drags the length back, on top of middle. Powell rocks back and punches it straight to cover.
A loopy full ball, on off, Johnson Charles clears the front foot to slog it powerfully, but only manages to drag it off the bottom half of the bat, to long on for a single.
Gets off the mark, does Powell. Shortish delivery, outside off, Rovman Powell waits for it and cuts it along the ground for a couple of runs to deep backward point. The 100 is up for West Indies!

OUT! IN THE AIR AND GONE! CAUGHT! Bethell gets a wicket now! Lands this quite fuller, does Bethell, just around the off stump. Sherfane Rutherford gets low on his knee to tonk it over long off, but neither does he time it well, nor does he get the distance. Slices it in the air, and to the right of long off, where Tom Banton runs to the right and takes a simple catch. A safe pair of hands in the deep and Sherfane Rutherford departs without much impact this evening. West Indies are 98/3 now.
Sherfane Rutherford c T Banton b J Bethell 6 (8b 1x4 0x6)

FOUR! This time, he gets it past the gap! Pushed across off by Bethell, from around the stumps. Short and width given, to which Sherfane Rutherford rocks back and cuts it between short third and backward point for a boundary.
Short in length, around off, Sherfane cuts it the point fielder.
Length-delivery, at the stumps, angling onto the pads, Johnson Charles tucks it through widish mid-wicket for one.
Full and outside off, floated up, Johnson Charles tries to slog that away, but misses and the ball passes under the inside edge.
Brings the angle closer to the stumps, does Jacks and gets some away turn as well. Sherfane Rutherford weighs on the back foot and taps this length ball to point.
Oh, some turn there for Jacks. Length, outside off, turning away sharply. Sherfane Rutherford stands tall and just fends it to the point region.
The length is pulled back, on the stumps, Johnson Charles hangs back and drags this to long on for a single.
Across off, on a length, Johnson Charles tries to play the reverse, but is beaten.
Drifting into the leg stump, full in length, Sherfane Rutherford flicks it behind square, around the short fine leg region for a single.
A slip in place, full and on off, Sherfane Rutherford strides forward and blocks it out.
Pitched a bit full and on the stumps, clipped towards deep mid-wicket for a single.

OUT! STUMPED! That is a sublime delivery from Rashid! West Indies lose their second wicket. Adil Rashid floats this one up, lands it fuller and on the middle stump line. The ball lands and takes the bite off the surface and spins wildly away from the batter. Shai Hope leaps forward to push it into the off side, but is beaten all ends up by the excessive spin. The ball beats the outside edge of the bat and Jamie Smith collects it cleanly behind the stumps, and whips the bails off in a flash. The side-on replay shows that Hope's back foot is outside the popping crease while the stumps are broken. Hope falls for 49 (38).
Shai Hope (c) st J Buttler b A Rashid 49 (38b 2x4 4x6)
A wrong 'un, on the stumps, worked off the inner half of the bat to the on side for a single.

SIX! A difficult chance for Wood in the deep, and he ends up palming it over the fence. Short in length, on off and middle, Johnson Charles hangs back and pulls this aerially, over deep square leg. Luke Wood moves a bit to his left and leaps and sticks his left hand over his hand to pluck the ball but it sails just over him for a six.
Slides this on the pads, does Adil, full in length. Shai Hope clips it to deep square leg for one.
Touch full, spinning away from off, Shai Hope pushes this to the cover-point region.
Shortish, outside off, Johnson Charles hangs back and punches this to the cover fielder. Halfway through the first inning, West Indies are 82/1.

Had to hurry there! Dawson dishes out another length ball, keeping it outside off, Shai Hope punches this wide of cover and straightaway rushes through for a single. Harry Brook is alert there and gets onto the ball quickly before releasing a quick throw to the keeper, Jamie Smith, who whips the bails in a flash. Johnson Charles dives to get home at the batter's end. He gets home safely with the dive, and the replays too, confirm the same.
The length is pulled back, with the line outside off, Johnson Charles stands tall and smashes this down to long off for a single.
Quicker ball, flatter outside off, Shai Hope gets on the back foot and cuts this to deep backward point for one.
Slowish delivery, tossed up outside off, Hope cuts this to the point fielder.
Wide outside off, short in length, Shai Hope taps it to the point region.
Finishes well after being taken for a six, does Bethell. Short ball, outside off, cut away through cover-point for a single.
Floated up, full and on middle, Johnson Charles gets forward and steers this through mid-wicket for a single.
Pushed through at the stumps, knocked back to the bowler.
FOUR! SHOT! Overpitched just outside off, Charles again gets low and smashes this over Bethell for a boundary down the ground.

SIX! Oh, just over Will Jacks! Pitched full and on off, Johnson Charles gets down on his knee and slogs it across and over deep mid-wicket. Will Jacks, relatively a tall man, leaps in the air, with his right hand stretched over his head, but the ball sails over him.
Flat and short outside off, Shai Hope rocks back and cuts it to deep point. Jamie Smith runs across to the left and intercepts the ball with a slide. A single taken.
Googly agaim, short and outside off, punched down to long on for one.
A googly, on a shortish length, turning back into the middle stump, Johnson Charles backs away and punches this past cover for a single.
Slides on off, full, Shai Hope leans on it and eases it through the point region for a single.
Short, on off, punched to Harry Brook toward cover, where the English skipper now makes a slight fumble to allow a single.
Drags the length back, does Adil, outside off, Johnson Charles cuts this to deep point where a fumble from Luke Wood in the deep allows the batters to sneak in the second run.
Pushed through on the stumps, full in length, Shai Hope flicks this through mid-wicket for a single.
On middle and leg, Shai Hope works this to deep square leg for a single. Excellent start from Bethell. Just 4 off it.
Short in length, outside off, slapped by Hope to short cover.
Digs it short, on off, Johnson Charles crouches a bit to pull along the ground to deep square leg. Another single taken.
Shortish delivery, on the leg stump line, Shai Hope nudges it in the vacant mid-wicket region for one.
Length ball, around off, Hope punches off the back foot to cover.
Bethell begins from around the stumps, slides a length ball into the pads, Johnson Charles stands tall and simply tucks it to deep mid-wicket for a single.
Gets away with it, does Brydon Carse. Very full and around off, this time Shai Hope can't get under it and drills it straight to mid off. West Indies are 55/1 at the end of the Powerplay!
No ball! A second one around the head height and a no ball is called. Quick bumper over middle and leg, Hope ducks under it again and he will have a Free Hit to look at now.

SIX! Shai Hope is playing a blinder here and the 50 comes up for West Indies. Fuller in length and angled across off, Shai Hope stays deep in his crease and gets under the ball before hammering it well over wide long off for another biggie.
A smirk from Shai Hope as he thinks that should have been a wide. Banged in well short and over leg, Hope ducks under the ball but it is called a fair delivery.
SIX! That's gone all the way! Hard-length delivery, outside off, Shai Hope goes after it and somehow manages to powerit up and over extra cover for a six.

Similar line and length to the last one, this time Shai Hope manages to manufacture a lofted shot that goes wide of mid on and towards the fence. The fielder at deep mid-wicket runs to his left and does well to keep it down to two runs.
Back of a length and at the batter, Hope pats it down to mid on.
Tossed-up delivery, around off, eased away towards cover for a single.
Bowled very full and outside off, Charles reaches out and drags it without much timing to mid-wicket or a single.

Good decision from the on-field umpire! Liam Dawson tries flighting one up and bowls it full on the pads. Johnson Charles sits down and gets inside the line to sweep but misses and the ball just very close to the bat and it is a good take from Jos Buttler behind the stumps. The bowler and the keeper appeal for a caught behind but it is turned down and Harry Brook opts for the review. Nothing on UltraEdge and it stays Not Out!

FOUR! The change of ends isn't working out for Liam Dawson at all. Bowled well short and over the stumps, Charles backs away well and punches it firmly through cover-point for the second boundary of the over.
Wide! Full and angled down leg again, Charles looks to sweep but misses.
Tossed up, full and on the pads, Johnson Charles goes for a genuine switch hit but misses the ball by a long way.
FOUR! A real freebie, just what Charles would have wanted at this moment. Short and wide, there to be hit. Johnson Charles slaps the ball away in front of point and picks up a boundary.
Wide! Tries to slip in a quicker delivery at the pads but spills it down leg for a wide.
Oh, that's gone through everyone! Slower one, into the pitch and around off, Johnson Charles is bamboozled by it but Jos Buttler too gets beaten by the awkward bounce and the batters get a bye.
Length ball on off, tapped away firmly in front of point for a quick single.

FOUR! Shai Hope attempting to shift gears quickly now. Shorter and wider outside off, Hope does well to cut it a bit late. The ball flies uppishly but through the vacant backward point region for another boundary.
SIX! Now, that is a shot! Good length around off, Shai Hope stays put and just swings through the line, whacking the ball a long way over long off for a biggie now.
FOUR! Just erring in line and Shai Hope picks up an easy boundary. On a length and angled down leg, tucked away neatly and fine enough from the fielder at long leg for a boundary.

Sharp work in the field! Fuller in length and at the stumps, driven straight to mid on and Johnson Charles looks to sneak in a quick single but Shai Hope sends him back. There is a direct hit at the bowler's end but Charles is well in.
Just one run off that over! That in-between length, in and around the stumps, Charles tries to back away and open up the off side but only manages to jam it out to covers.
Nicely bowled and Johnson Charles is starting to get bogged down here. Good length, around the top of off and just angling back in, Charles gets cramped for room and has to block it off.
Full and straight now, targeting the stumps, Charles stays leg side of the ball and jams it out towards mid off.
Swing and a miss! Hard length, dropping it around off and angling it across. Johnson Charles clears the front leg to swing across the line but fails to make a connection.
Good-length delivery, in the channel, this one zips through and holds its line after just starting to swing back in. Johnson Charles is caught on the crease and is beaten past the inside edge.
Pitches the ball up and spears it across the off stump, Hope stays leg side of the ball and has to reach for it. Ends up jamming it across to wide mid on for a single.
Flatter one, at the stumps, nudged away through square leg for a single.

SIX! That's a fine shot! The square boundaries are pretty big at this venue and Liam Dawson goes into the deck and angles it into the body as well. Shai Hope picks the length early, rocks back and pulls it over deep square leg for a biggie.
Quick and flat, darted in towards middle and leg, Hope rocks back and tucks it across to mid-wicket.
Fuller this time, and on off, driven down to long off for a single by Charles.
Nagging length at the stumps, Johnson Charles can't quite free his arms and ends up blocking it off.
Flatter one to begin with, angled into the pads, Charles fails to flick it away.
Top delivery to end a top first over from Luke Wood, just 3 runs and a wicket off it. Full again and around off, threatening to swing back in but just holds its line. Shai Hope is beaten all ends up.
Nice and full, on middle, swinging back in a fair bit as well. Hope manages to push it out to mid on.
Fuller delivery around off, a bit too full and looking to swing back in. Hope leans on and drives the full toss straight to covers.
On a good length and angling into the pads, Johnson Charles neatly tucks it down to fine leg and picks up a single to get off the mark.

Caught out, but it won't count as it is a Free Hit! Hard length, in and around the stumps, Shai Hope clears the front leg and looks to swing it over mid-wicket but ends up miscuing it badly to mid on. They do get the single, though.
No ball! Oh, that didn't come out as intended! Luke Wood goes searching for another yorker but ends up bowling a high full toss across the right-hander. A Free Hit to follow now...

OUT! LBW! That's plumb! What a start from Luke Wood and for England, a wicket off the very first ball and what a ball it was. Wood just strides in from over the wicket and darts a straight yorker in perfectly towards middle stump. Evin Lewis is taken aback and ends up playing all around it. The ball sneaks through to smash into the pads and the umpire's finger goes up almost instantly. Lewis reviews it pretty quickly too, and the third umpire is called in. UltraEdge shows that the bat hit the ground and not the ball and Ball Tracking comes up with three reds. A golden duck here for Lewis!
Evin Lewis lbw L Wood 0 (1b 0x4 0x6)
